Description: Ostracon, two adjoining sections (comprising 11 and 3 fragments respectively) of the body of a light-brown pottery wine-jar with slightly flaring lower-body, becoming convex at shoulder, and one handle remaining, the fabric contains many small white inclusions: the exterior of the larger section is covered with a burnished cream-coloured slip, now flaked away in many places, and faint traces of one line of black-painted hieratic text on the shoulder and a further three lines of text on the body; the exterior of the smaller section is covered with the same slip, also incomplete and much darkened, and very faint traces of further sections of the same text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393622) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393622)
Condition: fair (incomplete - two sections, comprising 11 and 3 fragments respectively)
